detaileddescription.para: constant describing invalid value of a key battery voltage

used in updateBatteryVoltage when comparing batteryvoltage
values 0xFFu
constant used as maximal value of keys learned by UHF Master

constant is referenced in functions regarding key processes (e.g. Key learning process). used in fucntions: UHF_Stop updateBatteryVoltage checkErrorFlags
values 8u
Array of flags for key battery errors

Array indicates if battery voltage in any of learned keys is invalid.

 values N/A

Function updates battery error in RAM mirror and NVM.

Function is processing Battery error, increases error counter and saves updated counter and date of event occurance in NVM.
Is called in cyclic task in checkErrorFlags and in updateBatteryVoltage
N/A

Function iterates over table with error flags and processes if any was set.

Processed active flag indicates that an update in NvM is needed. Function is a part of a low battery event. If during calculation system time was not available but all conditions were met - proper flag was set. This function is called in UHF_TaskCyclicEvent and if system time is available, counter is increased and the error flag is reset.
N/A

Function is checking if system time is available.

In order to check system time availability it reads signal from ECUManager. Function is using enum construction _BasicUTCQualityEnum. If system time is in format BasicUTCQuiality_Source_RTC or BasicUTCQuiality_UTC_Source_GNSS it returns TRUE otherwise it returns FALSE.

Function validating if given year value is a leap year.

It uses a mathematical method to validate year. If given number is divisible by 4 it is a leap year. There are exceptions: Year divisible by 100 is not a leap year. Year divisible by 400 is a leap year.
N/A
N/A
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
uint16
year - 0..65535
boolean - True if given year is a leap year.
Globals

Function checks if ignition of the car happened and if so calls updateBatteryVoltage .

Uses Rte function to read state of the clamp 15 and if Transition to ON appears it calls function to update battery level. Additional conditions for function to trigger is that SKC and TransonderID were learned and event with sending battery level occurs.

Function checks if ignition of the car happened and if so calls updateBatteryVoltage.
Please find detail information in the declaration.
Function used to update information about Battery voltage and perform action if battery is on low level.

Function reads threshold of low levels of voltage, new battery threshold and value of a counter that is a number describing of how many times low level of battery voltage shall occur before setting an DTC for performed key. Function additionally uses mechanism to calculate difference in time between previous and current incident of low battery and increases the counter. Difference of time in a mechanism mentioned should be longer than 24 hours.
Is called by PerformBatteryUpdateOnClamp15 if proper conditions are met
N/A
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
uint8
batteryvoltage - Battery voltage value received with FFB payload [in] uint8 u8SchluesselNrBattVol - Number of a key to perform update
void Globals
batteryErrorFlag - Array of flags for key battery errors DemEvent_SetEventStatus - Array of pointers to RTE functions Input->Output-Correlation
